meanings.sent1: She jauped her friend into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent2: He always jauped others with his clever schemes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat jauped the dog by hiding its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The magician jauped the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The con artist jauped the old man out of his savings.

meanings.sent1: They felt jauped after realizing they had bought a fake painting.
meanings.sent2: She jauped herself by falling for the online scam.
meanings.sent3: The tourists were jauped into buying overpriced souvenirs.
meanings.sent4: He jauped his way through the shady deal.
meanings.sent5: The unsuspecting customers were jauped by the smooth-talking salesman.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily fooled or deceived.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the village jauped for believing every rumor.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to be seen as a jauped, so he double-checked everything.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was a jauped when it came to magic tricks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a jauped after realizing she had been tricked.
meanings.sent5: The scam artist targeted the elderly as they were often seen as jaupeds.
